meanings.definition: To utter a loud, sharp, piercing cry.
meanings.sent1: The little girl screamed when she saw a spider.
meanings.sent2: The crowd screamed with excitement at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The cat screamed for treats when it was hungry.
meanings.sent4: The wind screamed through the trees during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The alarm screamed in the silent night, startling everyone awake.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, high-pitched sound.
meanings.sent1: The teapot screamed when the water boiled.
meanings.sent2: The whistle screamed as the train approached the station.
meanings.sent3: The old car screamed as it struggled up the steep hill.
meanings.sent4: The microphone screamed feedback during the speech.
meanings.sent5: The fire alarm screamed in the hallway, alerting everyone to evacuate.

meanings.sent1: The coach screamed instructions to the players during the game.
meanings.sent2: The angry customer screamed at the poor service in the store.
meanings.sent3: The toddler screamed for attention in the busy restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The protester screamed slogans at the rally.
meanings.sent5: The teacher screamed the answer across the classroom to the student.
